result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Defendant Michael L Bell in court with attorney M. Elizabeth Weathers.  Lindsey Hirt appeared for the State of Wisconsin. State moves to dismiss and read-in. Court grants and the matter is dismissed and read-in.
Plea/sentencing hearing on April 25, 2016 at 03:00 pm.

Defendant Michael L Bell in court with attorney M. Elizabeth Weathers.  Shawn N Woller appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defense counsel is requesting plea and sentencing date. Court grants.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for April 25, 2016 at 03:00 pm.

Defendant Michael L Bell in court with attorney M. Elizabeth Weathers.  Kevin Michael Osborne appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defense counsel was just appointed and is waiting for Discovery and request adjournment. Court grants.  Hearing scheduled for March 16, 2016 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant is not to have any violent contact with any family member.   Absolute sobriety, defendant is not to possess or consume any alcohol.  Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed.  Defendant to have no contact with business listed in the Criminal Complaint.

Defendant is eligible for State Public Defender representation.  An attorney will be appointed.  NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED.  Hearing scheduled for February 8, 2016 at 01:30 pm.

Attorney Mark P. Powers in court.   Defendant Michael L Bell did not appear.   Stephen Joseph Centinario appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Attorney Powers moves to withdraw as counsel. Court grants. Warrant/Capias remains outstanding.
Defendant Michael L Bell not in court.  Pablo Galaviz appeared for the State of Wisconsin. File to tag along with his other files.  Initial appearance scheduled for December 17, 2015 at 09:00 am.
